Package edu.cnm.deepdive.gravity.model

Class GameField

java.lang.Object
edu.cnm.deepdive.gravity.model.GameField
public class GameField extends Object
Represents the game field where gameplay occurs. Manages game elements such as the ship, enemies, and meteors.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameField(int x, int y)
    Constructs a GameField object with the specified dimensions.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameField

      public GameField(int x, int y)
      Constructs a GameField object with the specified dimensions.
      Parameters:
      x - The width of the game field.
      y - The height of the game field.

  • Method Details

    • getShip

      public Ship getShip()
      Retrieves the ship object within the game field.
      Returns:
      The Ship object representing the player's ship.

    • getProjectile

      public Projectile getProjectile()
      Retrieves the projectile object within the game field.
      Returns:
      The Projectile object.

    • getBoundingBox

      public Rect getBoundingBox()
      Retrieves the bounding box of the object.
      Returns:
      The Rect object representing the bounding box of the game field.

    • getLevel

      public int getLevel()
      Retrieves the level.
      Returns:
      int number of the currently level.

    • getCounter

      public int getCounter()
      Retrieves the counter of enemies destroyed.
      Returns:
      int number of enemies destroyed.

    • getGravity

      public double getGravity()
      Retrieves the gravity selected by user in the UI.
      Returns:
      representation of gravity in the format of double.

    • setGravity

      public void setGravity(double gravity)
      Sets the gravitational force affecting game elements.
      Parameters:
      gravity - The value representing the gravitational force.

    • getMeteors

      public List<Meteor> getMeteors()
      Retrieves the list of meteors present within the game field.
      Returns:
      A List of Meteor objects representing the meteors in the game field.

    • getEnemies

      public List<Enemy> getEnemies()
      Retrieves the list of enemies present within the game field.
      Returns:
      A List of Enemy objects representing the enemies in the game field.

    • setVelocity

      public void setVelocity(double velocity)
      Sets the velocity of the projectile based on user selection.
      Parameters:
      velocity - The value representing the velocity of the projectile.

    • setAngle

      public void setAngle(int angle)
      Sets the angle of the projectile based on user selection.
      Parameters:
      angle - The value representing the angle of the projectile.

    • start

      public void start(int level)
      Starts a game session at the specified level.
      Parameters:
      level - The level at which to start the game session.

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates game elements, handles collisions, and manages game state. - Updates the meteor list and enemy list. - Checks if the enemy list is empty and adds more enemies to the game field. - Checks if the projectile intersects an enemy, removing the enemy from the list and the game field. - Checks if any meteor intersects with the ship, leading to the ship's destruction and game over.

    • shipMoveUp

      public void shipMoveUp()
      Moves the ship upwards. Invokes the ship's movement method to move upward within the game field.

    • shipMoveDown

      public void shipMoveDown()
      Moves the ship downwards. Invokes the ship's movement method to move downward within the game field.

    • shoot

      public void shoot()
      Initiates the shooting action of the ship. - Sets the gravity, angle, and velocity of the projectile fired by the ship. - Fires the projectile from the ship.

    • addMeteor

      public void addMeteor()
      Adds a meteor to the game field while preventing intersection with existing meteors.

    • addEnemies

      public void addEnemies()
      Adds an enemy to the game field while preventing intersection with existing enemies.

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over based on specific conditions.
      Returns:
      true if the game is over; false otherwise. The game is considered over when the ship object is null and the level is greater than zero.
